summary:
The AFL is Australia's top professional Australian rules football league. It started in 1896 as the Victorian Football League and changed its name in 1990 to include teams from other states. There are now 18 teams, with Tasmania joining in 2028.

The season has 23 regular games, followed by finals for the top eight teams, leading to the grand final. The winning team is called the premiers and receives the premiership cup and flag. Carlton, Collingwood, and Essendon are the most successful clubs, each with 16 premierships. The current champions are the Brisbane Lions.
title: Australian Football League
